fried eggs.name: Fried Eggs
steps: Heat the frying pan over medium heat.
Melt a little butter.
Crack the eggs into the pan.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Fry until the desired doneness.

pasta.name: Pasta
steps: Pour water into a pot and bring to a boil.
Add salt to the water.
Add the pasta and cook for 7–10 minutes until tender.
Drain the water and add a bit of oil.
Mix well and serve.

rice.name: Boiled Rice
steps: Rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Boil water in a pot and add salt.
Add the rice and cook on low heat for 15–20 minutes with the lid on.
When the water is absorbed, add a bit of butter and mix.
Let it sit covered for 5 minutes.

buckwheat.name: Buckwheat Porridge
steps: Rinse the buckwheat under cold water.
Bring the water to a boil and add salt.
Add the buckwheat and cook for 15–20 minutes on low heat with the lid on.
When the water evaporates, add butter and mix.
Let it sit covered for 5 minutes.

boiled eggs.name: Boiled Eggs
steps: Place the eggs in a pot and cover with cold water.
Put on medium heat and bring to a boil.
Cook for 4–5 minutes for soft-boiled or 8–10 minutes for hard-boiled eggs.
Carefully drain the hot water and add cold water.
Peel and serve!

fried meat.name: Fried Meat
steps: Cut the meat into small pieces.
Heat a frying pan with oil.
Add the meat and fry over high heat until golden brown.
Reduce the heat, add salt, pepper, and spices.
Cover with a lid and cook for another 10–15 minutes until tender.

stewed meat.name: Stewed Meat
steps: Cut the meat into cubes.
Fry the meat in a pot or deep pan until lightly browned.
Add chopped onion and carrot, fry for another 5 minutes.
Add salt, pepper, and a bit of water or broth.
Cover and simmer over low heat for 40–50 minutes until tender.
Add extra spices if needed.

fried potatoes.name: Fried Potatoes
steps: Peel and cut the potatoes into thin slices or sticks.
Heat a frying pan with vegetable oil.
Add the potatoes and fry over medium heat without covering for 10–15 minutes.
Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
Add salt and, if you like, some onion.
When the potatoes are golden and soft — they’re ready!
